text: starting an exercise program
and being more active can be hard let's
discuss
some of the common barriers and tips for
starting
regular activity and exercise will help
strengthen the muscles around your joint
providing stability and helping your
mobility
physical activity actually feeds your
joints the cartilage in your joint
depends on movement
and loading in other words weight
bearing
to soak up nutrients and take away waste
at first you may feel pain when you're
active or exercising but it doesn't mean
you're damaging your joints
inactivity can contribute to weight gain
which increases the load on your joints
and is harmful to your health even if
you've been told you have no cartilage
left
and you need a joint replacement your
pain and function can improve with
activity and exercise
as well as make your recovery from
surgery easier and faster
after joint replacement surgery activity
and exercise are required
to improve pain and function
ask yourself what activities you enjoy
most
do you prefer to be indoors or outdoors
do you like to be on your own for quiet
time or do you prefer to be
with a friend or group for support and
socializing
do you like classes for direction and
motivation or do you prefer
to do your own thing make a plan
breaking down your activity or exercise
goal into smaller attainable chunks
will make it more manageable and easier
to do
use the smart or smart
method as a guide to make goals for
yourself
for example s stands for specific
what is it you want to do
measurable how much activity or exercise
do you want to do for example how long
would you like to go
time wise distance or steps attainable
does this plan fit into your life
and health situation relevant
do you like this exercise or activity
time limited when do you want to achieve
your goal
track your progress you can keep a diary
or use a step counter to see if you meet
your goals
it may be as simple as seeing if you can
accumulate at least
one activity or exercise period
per day this can be a great motivator
helping you form a healthy habit boost
your confidence
and help you move forward with your plan
step counters and activity trackers can
also help you track your progress and
motivate you
a family activity or an exercise buddy
can help make the activity more social
doing it together
helps you motivate each other
consider joining a community center or
club that does an activity that you like
you'll be sure to meet other people if
you don't have a solid block of time to
devote to physical activity
spread it out a 10-minute chunk of
activity will result in health benefits
incorporate activity and exercise into
the time
you already use if you watch tv consider
combining it with
activity by getting on the treadmill or
stationary bike
or doing some stretching you can do your
strength exercise
during commercial breaks add more
activity into your daily tasks think of
using stairs
instead of the elevator or parking
further away from your destination
could you actively commute to work or
part way there by walking or biking
you could walk or bike to do your
errands
book the time for physical activity in
your agenda
as you would a meeting or an appointment
it's a date for your health
sometimes just moving can make you feel
less tired
over time increasing your activity level
will help you build your energy levels
so you don't fatigue as easily
consider what time of day you feel less
tired this may be an easier time
to start a new habit
have an indoor activity like mall
walking or swimming at a community pool
if it's too cold wet hot or icy outdoors
you don't need to join a gym or use
machines
to be active or exercise physical
activity and exercise can be inexpensive
or free
walking in the park or a mall is free
if you want to gain strength you can use
cans of food
bottles of water or resistance bands
instead of gym weights
